lexUnit.name: divide.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: separate into parts or groups

sentence.text: Rats were divided into a control group ( group A ) , an antibiotic pretreated group ( group B ) , and a bacterial overgrowth group ( group C ) .
The factors affecting erosion on the coast may be divided into two broad groups .
There are frequent occasions in a drama session when children are divided into groups and asked to work on a task .
The animals were divided into five different groups , each group consisting of seven rats .
He divided the carpet into sections and painstakingly covered it with strips of Sellotape .
Pancreatic and venom PLA2s have been divided into two groups on the basis of the amino acid sequences of the enzyme proteins .
Each of these records is divided up into a number of fields , each holding one item of information such as name or address , or author or title .

The initial reports claimed that local fisherman had killed the dolphins in order to protect their fishing grounds and for dolphin meat , which was divided up amongst Fukue islanders in the East China Sea off Nagasaki .
I have divided these up into two groups -- for younger and older children .
` We can divide the chores between us , " said Dr Maingay with enthusiasm .
Divide the mixture between the tins and bake in a preheated oven at 350F/175C/gas 4 for 20-25 minutes .
A man asks Jesus to tell his brother to divide the property between them .
The agreement provided for a pool of $1,300 million to be divided between Drexel 's numerous creditors .
122 students were divided into two groups of 61 .
` Thus the groups countered the social alienation that often divides cancer patients from their well-meaning but anxious family and friends , " they write .
Entertainment , we divide our entertainment into two parts , television and attractions .
Subjects were divided into two groups of 71 .
Memories obviously lingered of the War Communism strategy of trying to divide richer from poorer peasants .
